    • Method Detail

      • perLineByte

        public static int perLineByte(int width,
                              int bpp,
                              int splitSize)
        This function is used to count the number of bytes per row.
        Parameters:
        width - [in] Width. Unit: pixel.
        bpp - [in] The value of bpp.
        splitSize - [in] The number of bytes aligned per row (row). Unit: byte.
        Returns:
        [out] The number of bytes per row (row).

      • get1BitColor

        public static int get1BitColor(int color)
        This function is used to convert the color to 1Bit color, either black or white.
        Parameters:
        color - [in] The color to convert.
        Returns:
        [out] 1 is black, 0 is white.

      • loadBitmap

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap loadBitmap(java.lang.String filepath)
        This function is used to load graphics resources from a file.
        Parameters:
        filepath - [in] The graphic filename to download, either an absolute (recommended) path or a relative path. Data type: Unicode; supported formats: BMP, GIF, EXIG, JPG, PNG and TIFF.
        Returns:
        [out] Return Bitmap object.

      • loadBitmap

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap loadBitmap(java.io.File file)
        This function is used to load graphics resources from a file.
        Parameters:
        file - [in] This is a valid File object. Supported formats: BMP, GIF, EXIG, JPG, PNG and TIFF.
        Returns:
        [out] Return Bitmap object.

      • convertColorToMono

        public static boolean convertColorToMono(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                                         RefObject<byte[]> monoData)
        This function is used to read the graphics data in a Bitmap object and convert the data to monochrome data.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - [in] This is a valid Bitmap object.
        monoData - [out] Return the monochrome graphic data of the graphic. The origin of the data is the upper left of the graphic, and each line is aligned with the number of bytes.
        Returns:
        [out] 'true' is correct; 'false' is incorrect.

      • createTextBitmap

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap createTextBitmap(android.graphics.Typeface fontType,
                                                       int fontsize,
                                                       boolean useBold,
                                                       boolean useItalic,
                                                       boolean useUnderline,
                                                       boolean useStrikeout,
                                                       java.lang.String data)
        This function is used to download the text graphic converted from the system font, and store the graphic into the printer.
        Parameters:
        fontType - [in] Font name of the system. Data type: Unicode.
        fontsize - [in] Font size. Range: >= 0.
        useBold - [in] Use of bold text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useItalic - [in] Use of italic text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useUnderline - [in] Use of underlined text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useStrikeout - [in] Use of strikethrough text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        data - [in] The string to convert into graphic file, cannot be empty string. Data type: Unicode.
        Returns:
        [out] Return the converted text graphics object.

      • createTextBitmap

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap createTextBitmap(android.graphics.Typeface fontType,
                                                       int fontsize,
                                                       boolean useBold,
                                                       boolean useItalic,
                                                       boolean useUnderline,
                                                       boolean useStrikeout,
                                                       java.lang.String data,
                                                       int useWidth)
        This function is used to download the text graphic converted from the system font, and store the graphic into the printer.
        Parameters:
        fontType - [in] Font name of the system. Data type: Unicode.
        fontsize - [in] Font size. Range: >= 0.
        useBold - [in] Use of bold text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useItalic - [in] Use of italic text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useUnderline - [in] Use of underlined text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        useStrikeout - [in] Use of strikethrough text. 'true' is to use; 'false' is not to use.
        data - [in] The string to convert into graphic file, cannot be empty string. Data type: Unicode.
        useWidth - [in] User-defined width. Range: >= 0; 0 means the system automatically calculates the width.
        Returns:
        [out] Return the converted text graphics object.

      • rotateToDegrees

        public static android.graphics.Bitmap rotateToDegrees(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                                                      int rotation)
        This function is used to read the graphics data in a Bitmap object and rotate it.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - [in] This is a valid Bitmap object.
        rotation - [in] Rotation angle. Range: 0, 90, 180, 270.
        Returns:
        [out] Return the rotated graphic object.
